text:
Welcome to How To Cook That I'm ANN REARDON
and today we are making a 3D Spiderman cake.

Spidey has always been super popular and now
he's in Captain America Civil War so there

have been a tonne of requests flooding in
for a Spiderman cake.

To make this one you will need two trays of
my chocolate cake and I'll put all of the

recipes on my HowToCookThat.net website and
I'll link to that below.

You can also print and cut out the template
from there.

And I've made that for you to make this cake
super easy to make.

Once your cake is cooled simply put the templates
on there and cut around each one using a knife.

Take a cake board and you will need to add
a support down the centre of this.

If you have a wooden cake-board you can just
drill a hole and put your support right in.

Spread some frosting on the base board to
stop the cake slipping and then add layer
number 1.

Spread it with some simple syrup and this
just helps keep the cake moist when we are
making a carved cake.

Then another layer of frosting, try and spread
this out to get it as level as you can.

And then continue to stack on layers 2, 3,
4, 5, 6, and 7.

Place the front template in front of the cake
and cut down the slope for Spiderman's muscley
shoulders and neck.

Now it is almost the right shape already because
you've used the template so you just need

to smooth off these corners on his neck so
it's not quite so square.

So just cut that off, take a tiny bit off
at a time because you can always cut off more.

Then cover the whole thing in frosting following
the shape of the cake, going in at the arms
and around his body.

For his head you'll need rice bubbles (Rice
Krispies) and marshmallows.

Just melt the marshmallows in the microwave,
30 seconds should do it.
And then mix through the rice bubbles.

Some people have been telling me in the comments
that they are subscribed but are not getting
notified of new videos.

The most reliable thing you can do is to subscribe
through my website - and I'll email you every
time there is a new video.

I'll add a link for email subscriptions just
below this video.

Place the head template under some baking
paper and pile up the rice bubbles on top.

And just use damp hands to shape Spiderman's
face shape.

Then turn it over onto the side and use the
side template to shape the back of his head.
It actually comes out quite a long way there.

Then you want to place that in the freezer
for about 15 minutes to set the gelatine that's
in the marshmallows.

Then add a cake spike into the base of the
head, which looks a bit gruesome but that's
going to hold it in place.

And it is best if you make this the day ahead
so that it can set really firm.
Then cover it with frosting.
And add it to the top of your cake.

Add some more frosting and smooth out the
join where the head is joining onto Spidey's
neck.

Take a long raindrop shaped piece of red fondant
and add it to the front of his face a bit
like a muzzle.

And then about halfway up flatten it to make
the base of his nose ... so that the nose
is sticking up a bit.

The bottom bit, you want to flatten it a bit
but not completely because the chin area is
also forward.

Then add a short snake of red going across
where his clavicle bone would be and then

wrapping up and around where that big neck
muscle comes down.

Then roll out some red fondant and completely
cover Spiderman's face and body.

Just use your hands to lift and smooth the
fondant - just gently push it in and around

his neck, it kind of looks like I am strangling
him there.
And just keep smoothing it out.

At the back squeeze together the excess and
trim it off with scissors.
Then smooth it down.

Then trim off the excess around the base to
make it nice and neat.

Using a fondant extruder make a long skinny
snake of black.

If you don't have one of these you could roll
them by hand but it's going to be very difficult
to get it perfectly even.

Add the lines going down Spidey's face just
using a little water to make them stick.
Then add the lines that go around his face.

Now, depending on the Spiderman that you are
looking at, the number and position of these
lines seem to vary.

So choose one that you like the look of and
copy that.

Then continue those lines from his face down
over his body.

Next we need to use the template to make the
spider.

Add all of the legs into place, just rolling
the ends to make them skinnier and pointier.

Roll a tiny bit for the fangs and use your
knife push it in the centre there.

And just use the tip of your knife to position
them pointing up.

Now roll a circle and elongate it at one end
so it's like a long teardrop.

And add that into place in the middle over
his legs.

Take a knife and indent it on each side and
across the top in the middle to split it into
a head and the abdomen.

Now place that in the freezer so that it can
firm up.

To make Spiderman's eyes cut around the template
in white fondant.

Then add a little bit of water around the
edge of that and add a strip of black all
the way around the outside of the eye.

Then using a little bit of water, add the
eye into place on Spiderman's face.

On the base of this arm add the strip of blue,
just coming across his chest under his peck
muscle there and around his arm.

And use your knife to push it in where his
arm meets his body and trim it off around
the base of the cake.

Take the spider out of the freezer, peel off
the baking paper and add it to the centre
of Spiderman's chest.
I really don't like spiders!

Using the colour of your choice, cover the
cake board in fondant.
And then your cake is ready.

It kinda feels like I am stabbing Peter Parker
when I cut into this cake.

Make sure you SHARE this video with a Spidey
fan.

Subscribe to HowToCookThat for more cakes,
chocolates and desserts.

Click here for my YouTube channel, here for
the recipe and here for the Avengers cake.
Put all of your request in the comments below.

'Ann Fan' of the week goes to this lovely
young lady who has The Deep Enders book and
has put a photo of it on her Instagram.

If you would like me to see your photos make
sure you hashtag them #howtocookthat
Make it a great week and I'll see you on Friday.
